title: Zen long run EQ-change in consumer confidence

content.description:
Include correctly labeled diagrams, if useful or required, in explaining your answers. A correctly labeled diagram must have all axes and curves clearly labeled and must show directional changes. If the question prompts you to “Calculate,” you must show how you arrived at your final answer.

Assume that the economy of country Zen is in long-run macroeconomic equilibrium.

(a) Draw a correctly labeled graph of the aggregate demand, short-run aggregate supply, and long-run aggregate supply curves, and show each of the following.

(i) The current equilibrium real output and price level, labeled <math alttext="Y sub 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Y</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="P L sub 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>PL</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, respectively

(ii) The full-employment output, labeled <math alttext="Y sub F" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Y</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>F</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>

(b) On your graph in part (a), show the short-run effect of an increase in consumer confidence. Label the new equilibrium real output <math alttext="Y sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Y</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and the new equilibrium price level <math alttext="P L sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>PL</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>.

(c) Assume that the banking system in Zen has ample reserves. Suppose that the central bank’s goal is to maintain a stable price level at <math alttext="P L sub 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>PL</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>. Based on the change in the price level shown in part (b), identify one specific monetary policy action the central bank would take to achieve its goal.

(d) Based on the monetary policy action identified in part (c), will real output increase, decrease, or stay the same in the short run? Explain.
content.question: Respond to all parts of the question.
